question: The thickened portion of the septum pellucidum represents <image 1>
description: The image shows a cross-sectional view of a brain, highlighting the septum pellucidum. The septum pellucidum is a thin membrane located in the midline of the brain, separating the lateral ventricles. In this image, there is a thickened portion of the septum pellucidum indicated by an arrow. This thickened area is likely to represent a specific structure within the septum pellucidum.
